intro: Asyneuma munzurdaghense, commonly known as the Munzur Mountain daisy, is a flowering plant native to the Munzur Mountains in Turkey. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to its harsh habitat. Its yellow flowers are surrounded by pale green bracts, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Asyneuma munzurdaghense is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological niche.
